World.headline: US Supreme Court strikes down Trump tariffs
World.summary: The US Supreme Court has delivered a major blow to President Donald Trump's trade policy. In a significant 6-3 decision, the court declared his global tariffs illegal, citing Trump's lack of authority under the International Emergency Economic Powers Act. This ruling could lead to billions in tariff refunds and impacts future executive actions on trade.
key_points: US Supreme Court struck down Trump's global tariffs as illegal.
The decision was 6-3, with Chief Justice Roberts citing a lack of authority.
Ruling could lead to billions in tariff refunds and impacts future trade actions.

World.headline: 'Effective immediately': After court setback, Trump imposes 10% global tariff on all countries
World.summary: Following a significant setback from the US Supreme Court's ruling on his trade policies, former President Trump has announced the immediate imposition of a new 10% global tariff. This move comes as a direct response to the court's decision and signifies a continued aggressive stance on international trade.
key_points: Trump imposes a new 10% global tariff 'effective immediately'.
The action follows a US Supreme Court ruling against his previous tariffs.
Signifies a continued aggressive stance on international trade.

World.headline: Zomato delivery boy killed after speeding car rams bike in Delhi’s Subhash Nagar; driver held
World.summary: A Zomato delivery boy tragically lost his life in Subhash Nagar, West Delhi, after being hit by a speeding car around 3 am. Police have taken the accused driver into custody and seized the vehicle. Investigations are ongoing to determine the precise sequence of events leading to the fatal accident.
key_points: Zomato delivery boy killed in a hit-and-run in Delhi's Subhash Nagar.
Accused driver was apprehended by police and vehicle seized.
Investigations are ongoing into the fatal accident.

World.headline: 'Shocked': Only daughter of ex-Isro employee who killed wife, refuses to fly from US for funeral
World.summary: A shocking incident unfolded in Bengaluru where a 70-year-old former ISRO employee killed his wife, fearing no one would care for her after his demise. The victim's daughter, residing in New Jersey, USA, refused to travel for legal procedures and the funeral. An extended family member completed the formalities and performed the cremation.
key_points: Ex-ISRO employee in Bengaluru killed his wife out of fear for her future care.
Daughter residing in the US refused to attend the funeral or legal procedures.
Extended family members handled the cremation and formalities.

World.headline: Trade deal on track, relations with India 'fantastic': Trump

Gor also revealed active negotiations for India to procure Venezuelan oil, with an interim trade deal imminent. India's foreign ministry emphasized its energy policy is driven by national interest.

World.headline: Israel launches strike on Lebanon; 10 dead including senior Hezbollah leader —video shows aftermath
World.summary: Israeli air strikes in Lebanon's Bekaa Valley killed at least 12 and wounded 50, reportedly targeting Hezbollah command centers. A senior Hezbollah leader was among the dead in these strikes. The attacks, among the deadliest recently, risk further escalating tensions and straining a fragile US-brokered ceasefire.

World.headline: US-sanctioned Iran-linked oil tanker spent 8 days in Pak maritime boundary: FIR
World.summary: An Iran-linked oil tanker, under US sanctions and later seized by the Indian Coast Guard, allegedly spent eight days within Pakistan's maritime boundaries with its tracking systems disabled. The vessel, along with two others, was apprehended for illegal oil smuggling and forgery. Investigations revealed ship-to-ship transfers of fuel and bitumen without informing authorities.

Seized by Indian Coast Guard for alleged illegal oil smuggling and forgery.

Despite costly dropped catches and a lack of big-match experience, their strong performances send a clear message to the ICC: give us more opportunities and results will follow.
key_points: Associate teams made a significant impact at the T20 World Cup.
Showcased fearless cricket, pushing top sides to the edge.
Called for more ICC opportunities and exposure despite crucial dropped catches.

Sports.headline: Asia Cup 2025: Indian-origin Jatinder Singh to led Oman
Sports.summary: Indian-origin cricketer Jatinder Singh has been named to lead the Oman team in the upcoming Asia Cup 2025. This appointment marks a significant leadership role for Singh on an international stage, highlighting his continued contribution to Oman cricket.
key_points: Indian-origin Jatinder Singh appointed captain of Oman for Asia Cup 2025.
Marks a significant leadership role on an international stage.

Sports.headline: FIDE WC in India: PM Modi says 'Chess is gaining popularity among our youth'
Sports.summary: Prime Minister Narendra Modi has highlighted the growing popularity of chess among Indian youth, particularly in the context of the FIDE World Cup being hosted in India. This endorsement underscores the sport's increasing appeal and its potential positive impact on younger generations across the nation.
key_points: PM Modi notes increasing popularity of chess among Indian youth.
Statement made in context of FIDE World Cup in India.
Underscores the sport's growing appeal and positive impact on younger generations.

Science.headline: Scientists finally reveal what’s inside Charles Darwin’s 200-year-old jars
Science.summary: Scientists have finally unveiled the contents of Charles Darwin's 200-year-old jars, providing a rare glimpse into the specimens he collected during his pioneering research. This discovery offers new insights into Darwin's methods and the biodiversity he studied, deepening understanding of his foundational work in evolutionary biology.
key_points: Contents of Charles Darwin's 200-year-old jars finally revealed.
Provides insights into Darwin's specimens and research methods.
Deepens understanding of his work in evolutionary biology.

Science.headline: Kuno National Park: Cheetah population grows to 38 as Gamini gives birth to 3 cubs, boosting Project Cheetah
Science.summary: Kuno National Park's cheetah population has increased to 38 following the birth of three cubs by Gamini, a female cheetah. This significant event provides a vital boost to the ongoing Project Cheetah, a crucial conservation initiative aimed at reintroducing and establishing a viable cheetah population in India.
key_points: Kuno National Park's cheetah population grew to 38.
Gamini gave birth to three cubs.
Provides a vital boost to the ongoing Project Cheetah conservation initiative.

Science.headline: 70-million-year-old dinosaur egg found in South America might hold a baby and reveal how dinosaurs raised their young
Science.summary: A remarkably preserved 70-million-year-old dinosaur egg discovered in South America shows potential to contain an intact embryo. This extraordinary find offers an unprecedented opportunity to gain insights into dinosaur parenting behaviors and how these ancient creatures might have raised their young.
key_points: A 70-million-year-old dinosaur egg found in South America.
Might contain a preserved embryo, offering rare insights.
Could reveal how dinosaurs raised their young and parenting behaviors.

Health.headline: Hero dog 'Ceto' sniffs out breast and colon cancer, saves couple's life
Health.summary: A remarkable dog named Ceto has been hailed as a hero for its incredible ability to sniff out early signs of both breast and colon cancer, potentially saving a couple's lives. This extraordinary feat highlights the emerging potential of animal detection in medical diagnostics and early disease intervention.
key_points: Hero dog 'Ceto' detected breast and colon cancer.
Potentially saved a couple's lives through early detection.
Highlights the potential of animal detection in medical diagnostics.

Health.headline: Good fasting sugar but high HbA1c: How is that possible? Doctor clears the confusion around diabetes tests
Health.summary: A doctor explains the apparent contradiction of having good fasting blood sugar levels while simultaneously showing a high HbA1c, clarifying common confusion around diabetes diagnostic tests. This distinction is crucial for understanding the difference between immediate glucose levels and long-term glucose control, offering vital insights for patients.
key_points: Doctor clarifies paradox of good fasting sugar but high HbA1c.
Explains confusion surrounding diabetes diagnostic tests.
Highlights distinction between immediate and long-term glucose control.

Health.headline: Diabetes diet alert: Expert reveals these common foods spike your blood sugar more than sugar itself
Health.summary: An expert has issued a critical diabetes diet alert, revealing that several common foods can unexpectedly spike blood sugar levels more significantly than sugar itself. This crucial information aims to educate individuals on overlooked dietary triggers, enabling better management of blood glucose and overall health.
key_points: Expert issues diabetes diet alert.
Reveals common foods can spike blood sugar more than pure sugar.
Aims to educate on overlooked dietary triggers for blood glucose management.

Health.headline: Your urine could signal danger: Doctor explains what to watch for
Health.summary: A doctor explains key indicators in urine that could signal potential health dangers, advising individuals on what specific changes or characteristics to watch for as early warning signs. Understanding these visual and other traits can prompt timely medical attention and potentially prevent serious health issues.
key_points: Doctor explains key urine indicators for potential health dangers.
Advises on specific changes to watch for as early warning signs.
Understanding these traits can prompt timely medical attention.
